trans-unit.source: Represents a control that contains audio and/or video.
When distributing media with your application, you cannot use a media file as a project resource.
In your project file, you must instead set the media type to `Content` and set `CopyToOutputDirectory` to `PreserveNewest` or `Always`.
MediaElement can be used in two different modes, depending on what is driving the control: independent mode or clock mode.

When used in the independent mode, the MediaElement is analogous to an image, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Source%2A> [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] can be directly specified.

In clock mode, the MediaElement can be thought of as a target for an animation, and thus it will have corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock> entries in the timing tree.
For more information on media modes, see the [Multimedia Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For an example of controlling a MediaElement in independent mode, see [How to: Control a MediaElement (Play, Pause, Stop, Volume, and Speed)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Until the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened> event has been raised, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight%2A> of the control will report as zero as the media content is used to determine the final size and location of the control.
For audio only content, these properties will always be zero.
For a fixed size control, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> and/or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> properties can be set.
However, to preserve the media's aspect ratio, set the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> properties but not both.
Instantiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref> class.
Arranges and sizes a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref> control.
Size used to arrange the control.
Size of the control.
Gets or sets a ratio of volume across speakers.
A value of -1 represents 100% of the left side speakers and 1 represents 100% of the right side speakers.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The ratio of volume across speakers in the range between -1 and 1.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Balance*> dependency property.
To be added.
Occurs when media buffering has ended.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.BufferingEnded"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates the percentage of buffering progress made.
The percentage of buffering completed for streaming content.
The value ranges from 0 to 1.
Occurs when media buffering has begun.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.BufferingStarted"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets a value indicating whether the media can be paused.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the media can be paused; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the clock associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> that controls media playback.
Setting this property puts the media element into a mode in which it utilizes the timing engine.
Any media that was previously playing is stopped and the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] associated with the new clock is opened.
A clock associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> that controls media playback.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Closes the media.
Gets a percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server.
A percentage value indicating the amount of download completed for content located on a remote server.
The value ranges from 0 to 1.
The default value is 0.
Gets a value indicating whether the media has audio.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the media has audio; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the media has video.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the media has video; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Get a value indicating whether the media is buffering.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the media is buffering; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the audio is muted.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if audio is muted; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.IsMuted*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the load behavior <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaState"></xref> for the media.

LoadedBehavior must be set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaState> in order to interactively control media with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Play%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Pause%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Stop%2A> methods.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The load behavior <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaState"></xref> set for the media.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaState"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.LoadedBehavior*> dependency property.
To be added.
Updates the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.DesiredSize*> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref>.
This method is called by a parent <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
This is the first pass of layout.
The upper limit the element should not exceed.
The desired size.
Occurs when the media has ended.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaEnded"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs when an error is encountered.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate|, with constraint of .|
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaFailed"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Occurs when media loading has finished.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate||
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets the natural duration of the media.
The value returned is independent of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.SpeedRatio%2A>.
NaturalDuration is not accurate until the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened> event has been raised.
The natural duration of the media.
Gets the height of the video associated with the media.
NaturalVideoHeight is not accurate until the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened> event has been raised.
The height of the video associated with the media.
Audio files will return zero.
Gets the width of the video associated with the media.
NaturalVideoWidth is not accurate until the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened> event has been raised.
The width of the video associated with the media.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref>.
Draws the content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> object during the render pass of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext"></xref> to draw.
Pauses media at the current position.
This method pauses the media if the media is currently running.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Play%2A> method can be used to resume.
This method can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
This method has an effect only if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.LoadedBehavior%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaState>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Plays media from the current position.
This method will begin the media if it is not currently active or resume media if it is paused.
This method has no effect if the media is currently running.
This method can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
This method has an effect only if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.LoadedBehavior%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaState>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the current position of progress through the media's playback time.
Setting this property can enable you to jump to different points in playback (also known as seeking).
Not all media types allow seek operations.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaFailed> event will fire if the media source does not allow seeking.
This property has no effect until after the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.MediaOpened> event has occurred.
This property can be set only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
The amount of time since the beginning of the media.
The default is 00:00:00.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when a script command is encountered in the media.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Routing strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate|, with constraint of |
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.ScriptCommand"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref> will update frames for seek operations while paused.
When set to `false`, seeking to a specific location will only update the displayed frame if media is playing.
Setting ScrubbingEnabled to `true` can incur some performance costs, especially when interactively controlling media playback.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if frames are updated while paused; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.ScrubbingEnabled*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a media source on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref>.
Setting the value of this property causes the media to play.
This property can be set only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, |
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that specifies the source of the element.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Source*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the speed ratio of the media.
This property can be set only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
Audio playback may not occur unless the value of SpeedRatio is 1.
The speed ratio of the media.
The valid range is between 0 (zero) and infinity.
Values less than 1 yield slower than normal playback, and values greater than 1 yield faster than normal playback.
Negative values are treated as 0.
The default value is 1.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Stops and resets media to be played from the beginning.
This method can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is `null`.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock%2A> property is non-`null`, the timing engine controls media playback behavior.
This method has an effect only if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.LoadedBehavior%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaState>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Clock*> property is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch"></xref> value that describes how a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement"></xref> fills the destination rectangle.
The following illustration demonstrates the different <xref:System.Windows.Media.Stretch> values.

![Different TileBrush Stretch settings](~/add/media/img-mmgraphics-stretchenum.jpg "Different TileBrush Stretch settings") Different gradient spread methods ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The stretch value for the rendered media.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Stretch"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that determines the restrictions on scaling that are applied to the image.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
The value that specifies the direction the element is stretched.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.StretchDirection"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.StretchDirection*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Stretch*> dependency property.
To be added.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The base URI of the current context.
Gets or sets the unload behavior <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaState"></xref> for the media.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The unload behavior <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.MediaState"></xref> for the media.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.UnloadedBehavior*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the media's volume.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The media's volume represented on a linear scale between 0 and 1.
The default is 0.5.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Volume*> dependency property.
To be added.
